p.em: (March 30, 2020) Please read the letter to families from the MA Department of Elementary and Secondary Education (DESE):
available now; other languages may be available on the
for a link to DESE-provided virtual education resources.

div.h2: Current school status (as of 3/25): Per the governor’s most recent order, springfield prep is closed until at least monday, may 4th. more information regarding our remote learning plans and other frequently asked questions will be provided shortly.
medication pickup: contact ms. hughes if you have medication questions

li.p: School Status: Per the governor’s most recent order, Springfield Prep is closed until at least Monday, May 4th. More information about our remote learning plans and other frequently asked questions will be provided shortly.
Meals: Springfield Prep is no longer providing meal service. If you are in need of meals, please visit one of the SPS locations below.

Springfield Public Schools meal sites: Boland, Bowles, Brookings, Chestnut Middle School, Commerce, Dorman, Glickman, Indian Orchard, Kensington, Liberty, Lincoln, Milton Bradley, Rebecca Johnson, Sumner, Talmadge, Warner and Washington. Meals will be available at the front door for breakfast, lunch and dinner between 11 a.m. and 1 p.m. to any person 18 years old or younger. Identification is not required.
Medication: To pick up medication, please contact our school nurse Sarah Hughes via Class Dojo or email at shughes@springfieldprep.org.

As of 3/25/2020: Instructional resources for the extended closure will be provided shortly. Please keep an eye on ClassDojo for additional information. We are mailing packets to complete the week of March 30th, in addition to resources sent out by teachers and posted to ClassDojo daily. While this work is not a substitute for in-school learning, we hope that it helps students maintain their learning routines. We recommend students working on their packet for 1-2 hours per day independently.

p.strong: Virtual read-alouds are happening! See ClassDojo for the link each day.

li.p: Resources for talking to your students about COVID-19: CDC, BrainPop, or this Comic Book
Chromebook set up and support: Please see our Chromebook User Guide

div.h3: CDC Coronavirus/COVID-19 Guidance and Health Information

li.p: If you or your children are feeling sick with a fever, cough, sore throat or runny nose, or are having difficulty breathing, please contact your doctor or the Massachusetts Department of Public Health at 617-983-6800. Please continue to follow good health & hygiene practices while at home: keeping distance between you and others, washing hands and cleaning surfaces frequently, etc.
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) website is the nationwide site for Coronavirus information

Massachusetts DPH website is frequently updated and highly recommended for any Coronavirus questions (currently available in Spanish, Portuguese, Arabic, Haitian Creole, Chinese, French, Italian, Khmer, Korean, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, and Vietnamese)
The 2-1-1 hotline in Massachusetts will now provide real-time COVID-19 information, resources, and referrals in multiple languages; call 211 from any home or cell phone, or live chat from Mass211.org

div.h3: For questions: (please use ClassDojo or email when possible!)

li.p: School operations or ClassDojo: Ms. Ashley Marshall, Operations Manager - amarshall@springfieldprep.org, 413-234-3180
Medications: Ms. Sarah Hughes, School Nurse - shughes@springfieldprep.org
Academics: Mrs. Jessica Yiannos, Principal - jyiannos@springfieldprep.org

General questions, concerns about policies: Mr. Bill Spirer, Executive Director - bspirer@springfieldprep.org, 413-234-3174, or Mrs. Meghan Wagner, Director of Finance and Operations - mwagner@springfieldprep.org, 413-297-5432

div.class: sqs-svg-icon--outer social-icon-alignment-center social-icons-color-white social-icons-size-large social-icons-shape-circle social-icons-style-knockout

div.p: Springfield Prep is an inclusive, K-5 (growing to K-8) public school for Springfield students. Our mission is to prepare all students for success in high school, college, and life.
div.h3:
594 Converse St.
Longmeadow, MA 01106
Phone: 413-231-2722
Fax: 413-215-0004
